und.value:
South Carolina

Monday, April 13, 1998

A minor earthquake, preliminary magnitude 3.9 according to the U.S. Geological Survey, occurred in South Carolina at 5:56 a.m. Eastern Daylight Time on April 13. The epicenter was about 25 miles (40 km) north-northeast of Camden, S.C.

The earthquake was felt in Camden and the surrounding area. The USGS has received no reports of damage at this time.

(Note to editors: As more information is received and the data are further analyzed, we may issue updates or clarifications on this event.)
